JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Mykola Mykolayovych Kocherga , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE , GPE region , GPE .

The applicant worked in the mining industry for DATE and developed an occupational lung disease and disability confirmed by the medical commission . Under ORG Act ( “ LAW ” ) he was entitled to receive different types of payments from ORG ( “ the Fund ” ) . According to the applicant , the Fund provided him with the majority of payments and other social benefits due to him . However , the ORG refused to pay him compensation for non - pecuniary damage , which was equally guaranteed by LAW , on the ground that the ORG budget for DATE had suspended the relevant provision of LAW and did not foresee funds for this type of payment .
The applicant challenged the above refusal in the NORP ORG in DATE .
By its decision of DATE , the court found in part for the applicant and awarded him CARDINAL NORP hryvnias , MONEY at the material time .

The ORG appealed against the judgment , claiming that compensation for non - pecuniary damage was not automatic and that the applicant had to prove he had suffered such damage , which he had failed to do . It further contended that the applicant ’s claim was belated and that LAW had suspended the relevant provisions of LAW and did not foresee expenses for this type of payment .

On DATE ORG of Appeal quashed the decision of the first - instance court and found against the applicant on the basis that the applicant had acquired a right to compensation after LAW for DATE had already come into force and suspended the relevant provision .

The applicant appealed on points of law . He maintained that the insurance scheme under which he had claimed compensation was formed of extra - budget funds and could not depend on the ORG budget . He further contested the conclusions of the court of appeal about the relevant provisions of LAW being suspended .
On DATE ORG refused the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal on points of law .
